title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu Mar 15, 2018 | 2:00pm EDT Editors Choice Pictures 
A child sleeps in a bag in the village of Beit Sawa, eastern Ghouta, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Reuters / Thursday, March 15, 2018 A child sleeps in a bag in the village of Beit Sawa, eastern Ghouta, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Close 1 / 25 
Columbine High School student Leah Zunder holds a sign during a National School Walkout to honor the 17 students and staff members killed at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, in Littleton, Colorado. REUTERS/Rick Wilking Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Columbine High School student Leah Zunder holds a sign during a National School Walkout to honor the 17 students and staff members killed at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, in Littleton, Colorado. REUTERS/Rick Wilking Close 2 / 25 
Dawn is reflected in the windows of the official residence of Russia's ambassador to Britain, in central London. REUTERS/Phil Noble Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Dawn is reflected in the windows of the official residence of Russia's ambassador to Britain, in central London. REUTERS/Phil Noble Close 3 / 25 
A 92-year-old man in a wheelchair, imprisoned for life in the Tokushima prison, for murder, rape and other offences, exercises with a care worker in a courtyard at the Tokushima prison in Tokushima, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A 92-year-old man in a wheelchair, imprisoned for life in the Tokushima prison, for murder, rape and other offences, exercises with a care worker in a courtyard at the Tokushima prison in Tokushima, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Close 4 / 25 
People attend a rally marking the fourth anniversary of Russia's annexation of Ukraine's Crimea region in the Black Sea port of Sevastopol, Crimea. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 People attend a rally marking the fourth anniversary of Russia's annexation of Ukraine's Crimea region in the Black Sea port of Sevastopol, Crimea. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov Close 5 / 25 
Davy Russell celebrates after riding Presenting Percy to victory in the 14:10 RSA Insurance Novices' Chase at the Cheltenham Festival. Action Images via Reuters/Andrew Boyers Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Davy Russell celebrates after riding Presenting Percy to victory in the 14:10 RSA Insurance Novices' Chase at the Cheltenham Festival. Action Images via Reuters/Andrew Boyers Close 6 / 25 
A visitor looks at early flowering Kanzakura cherry blossoms in full bloom at the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Issei Kato Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A visitor looks at early flowering Kanzakura cherry blossoms in full bloom at the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Issei Kato Close 7 / 25 
People supporting gun control attend a hearing by the Senate Judiciary Committee during a hearing about legislative proposals to improve school safety in the wake of the mass shooting at the high school in Parkland, Florida, on Capitol Hill in... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 People supporting gun control attend a hearing by the Senate Judiciary Committee during a hearing about legislative proposals to improve school safety in the wake of the mass shooting at the high school in Parkland, Florida, on Capitol Hill in Washington. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts Close 8 / 25 
Students from Gonzaga College High School in Washington, D.C., hold up signs with the names of those killed in the Parkland, Florida, school shooting during a protest for stricter gun control during a walkout by students at the U.S. Capitol in... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Students from Gonzaga College High School in Washington, D.C., hold up signs with the names of those killed in the Parkland, Florida, school shooting during a protest for stricter gun control during a walkout by students at the U.S. Capitol in Washington. REUTERS/Joshua Roberts Close 9 / 25 
A police dog takes part in a training session with a police officer in Shenyang, Liaoning province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A police dog takes part in a training session with a police officer in Shenyang, Liaoning province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Close 10 / 25 
U.S. President Donald Trump looks over an EA-18 Growler as he tours Boeing with Boeing Chairman and CEO Dennis Muilenburg (C) and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin (L) in St. Louis, Missouri. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 U.S. President Donald Trump looks over an EA-18 Growler as he tours Boeing with Boeing Chairman and CEO Dennis Muilenburg (C) and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin (L) in St. Louis, Missouri. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Close 11 / 25 
Ribbons tied to a section of the current border fence separating Mexico and the United States are seen in this picture taken from the Mexican side of the border in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Ribbons tied to a section of the current border fence separating Mexico and the United States are seen in this picture taken from the Mexican side of the border in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 12 / 25 
An injured demonstrator is detained by riot police during a protest against home auctions in Athens, Greece. REUTERS/Costas Baltas Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 An injured demonstrator is detained by riot police during a protest against home auctions in Athens, Greece. REUTERS/Costas Baltas Close 13 / 25 
Students participate in a march in support of the National School Walkout in the Queens borough of New York City. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Students participate in a march in support of the National School Walkout in the Queens borough of New York City. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Close 14 / 25 
Russian Ambassador to the United Nations Vassily Nebenzia looks at a mobile device during an urgent meeting called by Great Britain to the United Nations Security Council to brief members on former spy poisoning at U.N. headquarters in New York.... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Russian Ambassador to the United Nations Vassily Nebenzia looks at a mobile device during an urgent meeting called by Great Britain to the United Nations Security Council to brief members on former spy poisoning at U.N. headquarters in New York. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Close 15 / 25 
Miro Cerar, Slovenia's Prime Minister speaks during a news conference announcing his resignation in Ljubljana, Slovenia. REUTERS/Borut Zivulovic Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Miro Cerar, Slovenia's Prime Minister speaks during a news conference announcing his resignation in Ljubljana, Slovenia. REUTERS/Borut Zivulovic Close 
Buildings are seen among fog in Rizhao, Shandong province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Thursday, March 15, 2018 Buildings are seen among fog in Rizhao, Shandong province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Close 17 / 25 
General view of action during first round matches at the All England Open Badminton Championships. Action Images via Reuters/Peter Cziborra Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 General view of action during first round matches at the All England Open Badminton Championships. Action Images via Reuters/Peter Cziborra Close 18 / 25 
A woman jogs along the Rideau Canal during light snowfall in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. REUTERS/Chris Wattie Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A woman jogs along the Rideau Canal during light snowfall in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. REUTERS/Chris Wattie Close 19 / 25 
Students march from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School and Westglades Middle School to a nearby park as part of a National School Walkout to honor the 17 students and staff members killed at the school in Parkland, Florida. REUTERS/Joe Skipper Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Students march from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School and Westglades Middle School to a nearby park as part of a National School Walkout to honor the 17 students and staff members killed at the school in Parkland, Florida. REUTERS/Joe Skipper Close 20 / 25 
Hauwa (L) and Ya kaka, identified only by their first names, former captives of Boko Haram militants in Nigeria and now acting as advocates speaking out on behalf of other captives and survivors, pose for a portrait after they appeared on a panel... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Hauwa (L) and Ya kaka, identified only by their first names, former captives of Boko Haram militants in Nigeria and now acting as advocates speaking out on behalf of other captives and survivors, pose for a portrait after they appeared on a panel dealing with issues of violence against women in New York City. REUTERS/Mike Segar Close 21 / 25 
A Palestinian boy lies in a makeshift bed inside his family's shelter in Jordan Valley in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Mohamad Torokman Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A Palestinian boy lies in a makeshift bed inside his family's shelter in Jordan Valley in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Mohamad Torokman Close 22 / 25 
Beeves ridden by Sean Quinlan leads the 16:10 Glenfarclas Chase (Cross Country Chase) at the Cheltenham Festival. REUTERS/Darren Staples Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 Beeves ridden by Sean Quinlan leads the 16:10 Glenfarclas Chase (Cross Country Chase) at the Cheltenham Festival. REUTERS/Darren Staples Close 23 / 25 
A man takes the flag off the flagpole outside the consular section of Russia's Embassy in London, Britain. REUTERS/Phil Noble Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A man takes the flag off the flagpole outside the consular section of Russia's Embassy in London, Britain. REUTERS/Phil Noble Close 24 / 25 
A migrant from Cameroon looks on as he protects himself from the cold inside the Juventud 2000 shelter in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Wednesday, March 14, 2018 A migrant from Cameroon looks on as he protects himself from the cold inside the Juventud 2000 shelter in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close
